newsitem.title: USA: Lotus on track with Notes, Domino sales.
newsitem.headline: Lotus on track with Notes, Domino sales.

text.p: Lotus Development Corp on Monday said sales of its Lotus Notes and Domino groupware and messaging software products are on target with the company's 1997 estimates.

Lotus president Jeff Papows told Reuters that the company shipped 1.7 million units of its Lotus Notes program at the end of the first quarter. He noted that given the seasonality of the industry -- where sales are usually greater in the latter half of the year -- sales of Notes are ahead of expectations.
The company predicts it will ship 8 million units in 1997. It shipped 4.5 million units of the software in 1996.

Papows said Lotus, a unit of International Business Machines Corp, shipped about 75,000 units of its Domino server software package in the first quarter. He said the company expects to ship about 400,000 units in 1997.

Responding to recent concerns about the quality of Lotus' customer support for its products, Papows said the company's total staff has risen to about 8,500 from about 6,000 in 1996, with most of the growth coming in the area of support and consulting.

"We've had the classic growing pains associated with this kind of monumental growth," he told Reuters. "We almost can't add the human capital fast enought to deal with the immensity of the market share that we are creating."
